ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: - Introductory econometrics - First half getting the math down, second half learning more techniques - You'll learn some linear algebra too, which is good - Lots of IV
Yes, very important for political scientists.
Yes this course is necessary for a political scientist to understand important aspects of the discipline.

Yes, I would recommend the class to another student. I would recommend that the student review matrix algebra before beginning the course, though; I don't think math camp or last semester's Probability and Statistics course did quite enough to prepare us.
Introductory course in statistics and research design essential for any social scientist interested in pursuing empirical work.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: I understand the basic quantitative methods used in the discipline better than I did at the start of the course
Yes, I left this course with a better understanding of quantitative methods, which will be essential for my career as a political scientist.
This course did a lot to deepen my knowledge of the basic concepts of quantitative methods and I'm sure it will be extremely useful going forward!
I think it provided a pretty good foundation for quant research, though I would have liked a bit more research design.
